sentence.text: This study aimed to elucidate the potential functional mechanism of miR-135b-5p in migration, invasion and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (cytokine production) of pancreatic cancer cells.
By real-time PCR and analysis of GEO database, we determined the up-regulated expression of protein polyubiquitination-135b-5p in pancreatic cancer tissues and cell lines.
Functionally, Transwell assays indicated that protein polyubiquitination-135b-5p was a promoter for migration and invasion of pancreatic cancer cells.
Additionally, immunohistochemistry staining and Western blot showed that highly expressed protein polyubiquitination-135b-5p accelerated EMT process of pancreatic cancer cells.

Furthermore, a series of experiments and rescue experiments revealed that Nuclear Receptor Subfamily 3 Group C Member 2 (NR3C2) was the target of protein polyubiquitination-135b-5p in pancreatic cancer cells, mediating the promotion effects of miR-135b-5p on the tumor cells migration, invasion and cytokine production.

In conclusion, protein polyubiquitination-135b-5p, maybe a novel therapeutic target for pancreatic cancer, promoted migration, invasion and cytokine production of pancreatic cancer cells by targeting NR3C2
